title: Calories in 4oz Steak
meta_description: Discover calories in 4oz steak, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per 100g basis, and preparation tweaks for accurate tracking.
assumptions: Grilled sirloin steak, lean (trimmed of visible fat), cooked to medium; no added oils, sauces, or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut (e.g., ribeye vs. sirloin), fat content, cooking method, and portion accuracy. Check labels or use a food scale for precision.

quick_answer.text: A 4oz grilled lean sirloin steak provides ~226 kcal and ~31 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged products.

Add 1 tsp butter for cooking per 4oz

faqs.q: How many calories in 4oz grilled steak?
faqs.a: About 226 kcal for a lean sirloin, grilled without added fat.
Approximately 31 g protein, making it a high-protein option.

faqs.q: Does steak have carbs or fiber?
faqs.a: Zero carbs and zero fiber in plain grilled steak.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in steak?
faqs.a: Grilling or broiling keeps it lower; frying or adding butter/oil increases by 40-100 kcal per serving.

faqs.q: What about fat content in 4oz steak?
faqs.a: Around 11 g total fat, with 5 g saturated; choose lean cuts to reduce.
